article_node.title: Israel says Gazans free to exit while Hamas attends Cairo ceasefire talks
article_node.summary: Hamas' chief negotiator is in talks with Egyptian mediators about a potential ceasefire in the ongoing Gaza war, while Israel continues its military operations, including heavy airstrikes on Gaza City. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu suggested that Palestinians could leave the enclave, a notion that has drawn international condemnation, likening it to a forced displacement reminiscent of the 1948 Nakba. The humanitarian crisis in Gaza is dire, with reports of widespread starvation and malnutrition affecting the population, as the death toll from the conflict surpasses 60,000, prompting calls for increased aid and a ceasefire.
